intro: Eleocharis vierhapperi, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spike-rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, including marshes and shallow water areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Eleocharis vierhapperi plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
